p: The mean haematological profiles of untreated and treated mice with LEAM are given in Table 1. The mean haemoglobin content significantly reduced ( p < 0.05) following single-dose administration when compared to control. Relative to untreated mice, when treated with LEAM, WBC ( p < 0.01), and platelet count ( p < 0.05) augmented significantly. The differential blood count did not show any significant changes except lymphocyte percentage which showed a significant rise ( p < 0.01) when treated with LEAM. However, there were no significant differences ( p > 0.05) in RBC, HCT, MCV, MCH, and MCHC contents between control group and treated group (500 mg/kg b.wt. of LEAM).
